discussion.content: I know a lot of people said this already but this dump is legit. I had 90 questions including 3 labs. My suggestion is review all 1300 questions and focus on the ones you got wrong. For me I missed 328 questions out 1349. I study those and cram 24 hrs before my test. Once you study everything and learn the concept you will do just fine. The labs I got were not exactly like the ones on here but they were very similar. I skipped one lab, completed one and partially completed the last one. I was running out of time but I finished the exam with 10 minutes left. Most importantly I passed :). Good luck everyone! On to the next one!!!

I went through all the 1349 questions and this dump is legit and I took it before the implementation of new syllabus of CCNA v1.1. 
I had 88 questions including 3 lab questions. Two lab questions were quite similar and only one lab question on OSPF was quite different with required to perform only two main tasks. Each of the task was asking to two more sub-tasks.
Overall, study and understand the answer behind each of the question.
Congratulations you've reached a checkpoint :) Good luck with your exam

I would like to share more details for those who never have cisco exam before.(I take the exam on 15/6/2024)
1. You will be requested to take all your personal belonging into a locker.
2.A pen and paper will be provided to you to take note or calculating the subnet.
3.The time is enough if you finish all questions on this website as the questions are allmost the same with the question on this website. Please read the questions carefully. Do not miss the point you should have got. 
4. Please read the discussion of each question on this webpage if you are not want to pass the exam only. All discussions are very useful to have a deeper understanding of networking even though it may not cover in the exam. It can also help you to eliminate some options if you are not sure which one is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: What are two reasons to implement DHCP in a network? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The bandwidth setting of the interface is misconfigured.
choices.D: The interface is operating at a different speed than the connected device.
choices.C: The cable connection between the two devices is faulty.
choices.A: The interface is receiving excessive broadcast traffic.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What is a reason for poor performance on the network interface?

discussion.content:
What does lost carrier mean Cisco?

The "lost carrier" is when we do sense "something" coming towards the local receiver, but we cannot see our own data looped back on the medium. This is also detected by the local receiver and probably indicates a problem in the transmit direction of the cable or the loopback circuitry at the remote side.

Since we have 5 lost carriers as shown on the show interface command, this is indicative of a bad cable.
Ref: https://community.cisco.com/t5/switching/the-difference-between-quot-lost-carrier-quot-and-quot-no/td-p/1242625

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
Lost carrier means cable (phisical) issue.
CRC counter means phisical issue.

comments.content: From the output, how do you know the cable connection is faulty?
As far i know if the CRC counter is that high there is a highly chance of physical issue in that connection... Either cable or the socket has a problem.

It seems that youre right. Thanks! 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/servers-unified-computing/ucs-infrastructure-ucs-manager-software/215449-commands-for-troubleshooting-connectivit.html#toc-hId--1095738066

--------------
Reasons for Bad Frames and CRC Errors 
Some of the reasons when you get bad frames and CRC errors can be:

Bad physical connection; transceiver, copper, fiber, adapter, port expander, and so on.
MTU Violation
Received bad CRC stomped from neighboring cut-through switch.

 no shutdown
copy running-config startup-config

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-


Guidelines
-

This is a lab item in which tasks will be performed on virtual devices.

• Refer to the Tasks tab to view the tasks for this lab item.
• Refer to the Topology tab to access the device console(s) and perform the tasks.
• Console access is available for all required devices by clicking the device icon or using the tab(s) above the console window.
• All necessary preconfigurations have been applied.
• Do not change the enable password or hostname for any device.
• Save your configurations to NVRAM before moving to the next item.
• Click Next at the bottom of the screen to submit this lab and move to the next question.
• When Next is clicked, the lab doses and cannot be reopened.


Topology
-

//IMG//



Tasks
-

SW-3 and SW-4 are preconfigured with all necessary commands. All physical cabling is in place and verified. All connectivity must be operational.

1. Configure both SW-1 and SW-2 switch ports e0/0 and e0/1 for 802.1q trunking with only VLANS 1, 12, and 22 permitted.
2. Configure SW-1 port e0/2 for 802.1q trunking and include only VLANS 12 and 22.
3. Configure both SW-1 and SW-2 switch ports e0/0 and e0/1 for link aggregation using the industry standard protocol. All ports must be configured so that they immediately negotiate the link.

discussion.content: For task 3, it shouldn't use sticky, because it requires mac addresses be learned dynamically. If sticky, once the first is learned, it won't be able to learn further addresses.

Task 1) [vigerence means use 'service password-encryption', no cryptokeys/domain cause its telnet not ssh]
en
conf t
username netops password ipsec4all
service password-encrption
line vty 0 4
login local
transport input telnet

Task 2) ["restrict only pc1" is worded weird but I believe SnowWhiteYeti is correct and we are meant to use a deny statement]
ip access-list extended ENT_ACL
deny icmp host 172.16.10.10 host 172.16.20.10
permit tcp host 172.16.10.10 host 172.16.30.2 eq 23
deny tcp any any eq 23
permit ip any any
exit
int vlan 10
ip acces0gr ENT_ACL in
ex

Task 3)
int e0/0
switchport port-security max 2
sw port-sec violation restrict
sw port-sec mac sticky

This makes sense to me but let me know your thoughts

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION
-


Guidelines
-

This is a lab item in which tasks will be performed on virtual devices.

• Refer to the Tasks tab to view the tasks for this lab item.
• Refer to the Topology tab to access the device console(s) and perform the tasks.
• Console access is available for all required devices by clicking the device icon or using the tab(s) above the console window.
• All necessary preconfigurations have been applied.
• Do not change the enable password or hostname for any device.
• Save your configurations to NVRAM before moving to the next item.
• Click Next at the bottom of the screen to submit this lab and move to the next question.
• When Next is clicked, the lab doses and cannot be reopened.


Topology
-

//IMG//



Tasks
-

Refer to the topology. All physical cabling is in place. Configure a local user account, a Named ACL (NACL) and security.

1. Configure a local account on Sw101 with telnet access only on virtual ports 0-4. Use the following information:

o Username: netops
o Password: ipsec4all
o Algorithm: "Vigenere"
o Privilege level: Exec mode

2. Configure and apply a single NACL on Sw103 using the following:

o name: ENT_ACL
o Restrict only PC1 on VLAN 10 from pinging PC2
o Allow only PC1 on VLAN 10 to telnet to R1 (172.16.30.2)
o Prevent all other devices from telnetting from VLAN 10
o Allow all other network traffic from VLAN 10

3. Configure security on interface Ethernet 0/0 of Sw102:

o Set the maximum number of secure MAC addresses to two
o Ensure that the port discards the packet, counts the number of violations and sends a syslog message
o Allow secure mac addresses to be learned dynamically

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The IPv6 address for the LAN segment on router R2 must be configured using the EUI-64 format. When configured which ipv6 address is produced by the router?

remember 7th bit For Figuring Fast Eui64 (7th bit FFFE)

Add FF:FE beetwen B6 B4 in this case and you find IPv6 EUI-64

Selected Answer: A
CA - 1100 1010
Invert 7th bit => 1100 1000 => C8

Hence, the correct answer is A...

Selected Answer: A
ca = 11001010
inverted 7th bit = 11001000 = c8
ans = c801:b6ff:feb4:1

convert 7th bit cA becomes c8 .
